Thanks a lot for your post. I asked my Doctor to give me a full panel because of my past drug use. Well I was told that I had a positive antibody for hep c. My doctor told me that more than likely my hep c was in remission. I have been clean and sober going on nine years, and was never really into alcohol, and these days I am so scared to even take a anything over the counter. My doctor does have me on 5mg of Xanax at night for sleep. I have asked him a lot of times if he is sure that the Xanax is okay to take, and he always promises me that it's fine to take. Other than that one time that I took a panel and they said I was positive for an anti body I have had no other check ups. The doctor says I seem to be fine but when I'm ready to see a specialist he will refer me to one. What do you recommend. I really do feel great and have no symptoms, but at the same time I am worried because I have had a lot of friends die from Hep C. One thing I will mention is they also continued to use, and live in there addictions. Like I said I have been clean and sober going on nine years, and other than what the doctor says is okay for me to take I wont touch out of fear.
